comment.author: 25752562@N07
comment._content: I believe this is a sycamore tree.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: More from our researcher Ed: www.haryana-online.com/Flora/barh.htm www.hort.purdue.edu/ext/senior/ornament/ameri2.htm The source website shows a Banyan Tree with a leaf enlarged. On close observation the leaves on the tree in the lantern slide seem to closely resemble a banyan, and not a sycamore whose leaves are shown in website #2. In addition, the growth pattern of the limbs seem to resemble the Banyan tree. It was interesting to find however, the level of reverence and iconic importance in Egyptian history given to the sycamore tree. The actual lantern slide has a commercially printed label, with the title as listed.
